reviews.review_msg: definately really passionate about the course, and really really interesting material to boot, but the tests can really throw you for a loop. quite tough, but still pretty fair.
laid back instructor, lots of fish examples, notes confusing at times with arrows, sometimes unorganized, but overall really good prof and easy exams
Very entertaining professor.  Notes are quite good...generally nice guy.
Exaggerates on some things, but knowledgeable, entertaining :)
Over all a really good prof, good lecturers. Class content was interesting. Exams were long but marking is fair. Would definitely recommend taking this class with him!

This was one of my favorite classes this semester. Julian goes at a really good pace when teaching and doesn't expect you to have too much previous knowledge. The course material is also very interesting. I found he was a fair grader and if the average was low for an exam, he curved up.

Although he is a good professor in terms of teaching, the fact that for the exams we had to be very specific for the questions made me fell upset. Dr. Christians is a very tough grader and he was looking for specific answers in terms of the exam questions. Overall, he is a nice person but I would not recommend taking a class with him.

Dr. Christians nice person, not a good lecturer. He's open to questions which is nice, and I reccomend asking. Exams are not your standard exams, you could study lots but it means nothing if you don't know how to problem solve with his questions. I suggest going to all lectures and focusing on all clicker questions that he asks.

Tough tests. You have to understand the material, which isn't easy, to do well on the exams. Memorization will absolutely not help. Exams are all problem solving and intepretation of novel data. Hard course but rewarding if physiology is an interest.

I have no idea why he doesn't have A LOT more ratings. I feel I can very confidently say on behalf of every single student in the class that he's one of everyone's favourite professors at SFU! Loved the course, thanks for everything!

Lectures are very entertaining, you'll never want to miss one! I'm not even a biology major but he totally captivated me in the subject matter and makes me *almost* want to change my degree. Definitely wait around to take courses when he's teaching them!

His teachings feel almost backwards. Although the "review" is nice, his pace and material feel more diluted than the two courses pre-req to his class. I feel like an idiot for being in this so-called "4th" level course, expecting to learn something. It feels like a 200 level course. Either it's his fault or not, his teachings doesn't make it better
